metadata.title: CVE-2020-14386 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.9-rc4. Memory corruption canbe exploited to gain root privileges from unprivileged processes. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality andintegrity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-117-generic - 4.15.0-117.118
linux-image-4.15.0-117-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-117.118
linux-image-4.15.0-117-lowlatency - 4.15.0-117.118
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-117-generic - 4.15.0-117.118
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-117-lowlatency - 4.15.0-117.118
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-67-generic - 5.3.0-67.61

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-117.118').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-67.61').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-47.51~18.04.1').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.86').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
